title: Gmail Configuration Error

The gmail pop-up should happen to allow access, but no pop-up happens. I have followed the instructions per your guidelines (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/automatic-conversion-google-mail-accounts-oauth20), enabled cookies and added exceptions, but have had no success. Please help.
creator: seawaterspirit

title: Giant draft filled with images
content:
Hi. This is going to be a strange question for you. Someone in my family (inexperienced with computers), pasted daily PNG screengrabs into a draft for a month, hoping to email it to somebody. They didn’t understand it would create a massive 300mb draft that could not be sent. The screengrabs can’t be taken again, so this is the only place they’re saved.

So I thought I would simply save out the draft as an HTML file, which has the images embedded. However, the HTML file only shows the images up to a point (only shows 10 out of 30), after which it’s just blank white space. That’s because there’s a little yellow banner at the bottom of the draft with an Options button saying the images have been locked, and I need to unlock them in order to include them in the draft. When I do that for all 20 images, however, they don’t appear in the email body, so even if I save out an HTML file after that, it still only shows a blank space. I thought maybe hitting F5 to refresh the screen would do it, but it doesn’t. Nor does trying to forward the draft as a new draft (still blank space). Maybe you now of a way to refresh the draft view?

When I unlocked all the images, I could see some of the path, which looked like they were saved inside the Draft mailbox file (I could even see the PNG extension for each image). So I was thinking, maybe there’s a way to access the files inside the mailbox in order to extract the PNGs but unfortunately I couldn’t find one.

So if you have any suggestions for my predicament, I would be grateful. - Alan
creator: fireos5

title: Send does not work with CardBook enabled
content:
Since upgrading to version 128.3.3esr (Build 20241023091249) on Arch Linux sending messages does not work any more. After clicking the Send button, choosing Send in the toolbar menu, or using <Ctrl>+<Enter>, all buttons and the toolbar menu becomes inactive (greyed out), but the message is not send. The behavior occurs on different mail accounts.

When starting Thunderbird from the terminal the following error occurs: JavaScript error: moz-extension://cd757c35-cc8e-45ec-b1a7-c66dfbe94276/background.js, line 3070: TypeError: action is undefined

Restarting Thunderbird in safe-mode resolves this issue and there is no error message in the terminal.

Deactivating add-ons one by one, as mentioned in [1120568], reveals that CardBook seems to be causing this issue. For this reason, I sent a copy of this question to the add-on support contact.

title: Lightning Calendar and VCS Files
content:
Hello, I am replacing the Outlook integrated local calendar on Windows 10 with Lightning, given the fact that Microsoft has decided to remove it from their OS.

I just came across two webinars invites that only propose VCS files (and not ics files) for adding the event in my local Lightning calendar.

As this was not working when I clicked on the invite to directly add it to Lightning I made some research and found out that there is the following Add-on for Thunderbird Lightning: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/vcs-support/

However the last update for this add-on is dating back 2011 and the last comment is from 2015...

In terms of security I am not sure that I want to install this add-on and I am not even sure that it is working.

Could the Thunderbird Lightning Developers maybe add the native functionality of accepting these files for setting events in the Lightning calendar?

Thank you very much and great work this community is doing!
creator: Senna-sport

title: Lightning versus Outlook Calendar
content:
Hello Dear Thunderbird and Lightning Community!

Microsoft is removing their local Outlook calendar from Windows OS at the end of this year, and have already started to remove the direct to accessing it through their regular updates.

As I am looking for a local, reliable Calendar that would be on top of that open source, I found out Lightning as a further add-on/extension to Thunderbird.

Given the general context I have mentioned in the beginning, this is an historical opportunity for the open source community to raise Lightning as a major alternative to Outlook Calendar (and not only Thunderbird globally).

Why not offering Ligthning also, as a pure STANDALONE, local (with online calendar for people who wish it), but at east as a local possibility without NEEDING to instal Thunderbird as a whole?

That would make a lot of sense.

Thank you very much and great Kudos for all your great work!!!

Cheers :)
creator: Senna-sport

title: Issues with Email Retrieval and Notifications in Thunderbird
content:
Hi there, I had chatgpt help me write my message because I was big mad about e-mail not working. The below is my actual concern but summarized much more nicely than I could ever write it.

I am writing to seek assistance with an ongoing issue I have been experiencing while using Thunderbird as my email client.

I have a self-signed certificate for my email server, and I frequently encounter problems with Thunderbird not being able to retrieve my emails. It seems that every once in a while, Thunderbird refuses to accept the certificate, prompting me to remove and re-add my email account entirely. I have tried manually removing the certificate and re-adding it; however, Thunderbird consistently reports that it is a valid certificate.

When I remove and re-add my account, I am prompted again to accept a security exception, which I do, and then my email retrieval works correctly. My concern is: why do I have to constantly add exceptions, and why does email not work if Thunderbird reports the certificate is valid?

Additionally, I am having issues with notifications. Specifically, I would like to know how to prevent Thunderbird from showing notifications through my OS notification bar. Recently, I received a notification about being unable to connect, but it was cut off, leaving me unaware of the full message and details. It is quite frustrating, as it shouldn’t be this complicated to manage an email client in 2024.

For your reference, I am using Pop!_OS 22.04, which is based on Ubuntu. My current version of Thunderbird is 128.3.3esr(64-bit).

Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your guidance on these issues.

Best regards,

Peter Cooper peter.cooper@elephantbox.net
creator: peter.cooper1

title: Thunderbird and new hotmail/outlook authentication
content:
Thunderbird 128.3.3esr 1) Hotmail required authentication to be changed to OAuth2. Despite doing this I still get Authentication failures in the same Thunderbird session although closing and reopening the Account Settings shows authentication as OAuth2.

2) Once Thunderbird is closed and re-opened the Account Settings shows authentication has reverted to normal password.

3) I've tried deleting the account. It reappears on next load of Thunderbird even when I've also deleted pop-mail.outlook.com from the profile (There is only one and it is the default). The pop-mail.outlook.com entry also reappears.

I'm considering deleting Thunderbird and attempting to reinstall (I know enough to be able to preserve what mail I want) but if that fails to solve the problem I suppose I'll have to give up on Thunderbird and find another mail client.

I've used Thunderbird for many years and occasionally contributed to Mozilla's requests for a contribution but until this is resolved I shall continue to ignore Mozilla's persistent and annoying request for a contribution. After all - even if I were to contribute could I be sure that request wouldn't continue?

title: Wachtwoorden en toestemming berichten weer te geven
content:
Als ik een nieuwe installatie moet doen (b.v. omdat Linux Mint een nieuwe versie uitbrengt) en de voorkeur geef aan en z.g. schone installatie kopieer ik vooraf in de “oude versie” de (verborgen!) map .thunderbird. Na installatie hernoem ik de bij de installatie van Mint nieuw aangemaakte, lege, map .thunderbird naar .thunderbird-a. Het programma open ik NIET. Hierna plak ik de “oude”, gekopieerde, map .thunderbird naar de nieuwe Mint installatie en plaats de kopie in de map bij de inmiddels hernoemde .thunderbird-a map. Ik zie dan dus staan .thunderbird en .thunderbird-a. Als ik nu Thunderbird start zie ik (tot mijn blijdschap) direct en zonder nadere inspanningen alle e-mail Accounts en e-mail verschijnen. Dit werkt prima met IMAP of het met POP werkt weet ik niet want dat gebruik ik al heel lang niet meer.

Je zou dus zeggen alles voor elkaar. Helaas zijn er twee dingen die niet werken en ik hoop dat ik dat ook kan “automatiseren”.

1. Wachtwoorden. Met deze transitie worden de wachtwoorden van de accounts NIET meegenomen en die moet ik achteraf weer invoeren, bij MS zelfs na een beveiligingscode te hebben opgehaald. Mijn vraag is derhalve: waar, in welk bestand en in welke map, worden de wachtwoorden van de Thunderbird accounts opgeslagen, want die staan kennelijk niet in de .thunderbird-map. Ik zou die data en map(pen) dan kopiëren en in de nieuwe installatie op de juist plaats kunnen plakken; zou moeten werken lijkt mij.

2. Veiligheidscontrole berichten. Als je een bericht ontvangt van een nieuwe afzender moet je toestemming verlenen om dat bericht te openen/lezen. Dat is op zich een prima voorziening, maar als je - nadat je de transitie hebt gedaan als hiervoor beschreven - weer letterlijk bij elk bericht wat je “voor het eerst” ziet moet aangeven dat je het toestaat om gelezen te worden, wordt je wel een beetje erg melig; gelukkig is het wel zo, net als bij “nieuw”, dat je dat alleen bij het eerste bericht moet aangeven. Mijn vraag is ook nu: in welk bestand en in welke map zijn deze data opgeslagen zodat ik die data ook kan kopiëren en in de nieuwe installatie kan plakken.

Ik ben mij ervan bewust dat dit niet kan werken, dan moet ik die bijwerking van wachtwoorden etc. maar handmatig blijven doen, maar liever niet.

Alvast dank voor een reactie
creator: jan.kol40

title: Thunderbird 'hangs' on Send
content:
Last Saturday, with no warning or outward signs of errors, after I had constructed (from Template) a standard response to an incoming email and pressed send (as I do several time a week) that email failed to send, instead going to Drafts after a minute or so. No error messages shown.

I have 4 accounts set up on TB (and have had for the past year) two standard hosted accounts, one Virgin Media (all POP) and one Gmail. Same problem on all of them.

This is all quite beyond me - everything else works fine, I'm still receiving email OK (about 20 or so a day), and the last I successfully sent was Friday evening.

However I create an email - from scratch, a forward or reply - pressing Send dims out the top Send/Encrypt/Spelling/Save line, and my email address just below that; and I don't get the 'sending' message in the body of the email. After a couple of minutes more the Send button goes black again - if I press it again the 'transfer into Drafts cycle' starts again.

I've compacted the drafts folder in each account but I can't seem to do anything which will stop TB hanging on 'send'.

Any thoughts - before I go for the nuclear action and change mail apps? I use k9 on my phone with the same set of accounts with no problem (except my fat fingers!)

Robin

IT SEEMS these emails are all still on my Windows PC in the following folder (based on same subfolder names of .sbd files and very large size of associated files):

C:\Users\landf\AppData\Roaming\PelagiaThunderbirdBACKUP\aemnj0nh.default-release-20241028-1143\Mail\Local Folders

My email server no longer supports POP3 so I have to use IMAP for new emails. BUT, I need access to all my old emails (they are no longer on the server).

I've tried copying folders to Local Folders, but no luck.

Any help?

Thank you.
